data.meta_description: JAZZ INTERACTIVE LEARNING (Jazz) was formed to become the leading web-enabled publisher of educational software. The company’s proven teaching technologies are based upon proven teaching technologies researched at Vanderbilt University by Laura Goin and Dr. Ted Hasselbring, Co-Director of...
data.text:
JAZZ INTERACTIVE LEARNING (Jazz) was formed to become the leading web-enabled publisher of educational software. The company’s proven teaching technologies are based upon proven teaching technologies researched at Vanderbilt University by Laura Goin and Dr. Ted Hasselbring, Co-Director of Vanderbilt’s Learning Technology Center. Jazz’s product lines consist of three proprietary teaching technologies: an Assessment Engine; a patentable Fluency Engine; and a 3D Problem Solver Conceptual Teaching Engine. These teaching engines take best advantage of what computers are made to do, analyze student performance data and customize the learning experience. It works!

JOAN ZIEGLER, PRESIDENT & CEO was a founding member and Senior Vice President of Sales and Marketing for Hi Tech Expressions while it grew to become a $40 million software publisher within six years and raised $5.8 million in venture capital funding from Venrock, Matrix, Vertex and Volpe Welte. Recruited to Software Toolworks/Mindscape as Senior Vice President, with P & L responsibility of the Home and Kids Division (Home and Kids division was 60% of the $140M revenue of Software Toolworks). Software Toolworks/ Mindscape was subsequently acquired by Pearson and Joan left to found Jazz Interactive, Inc.

DR. TED HASSELBRING, CO-DIRECTOR OF THE LEARNING TECHNOLOGY CENTER AT VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY AND CHAIRMAN OF THE JAZZ PROFESSIONAL ADVISORY BOARD, pioneered the proprietary research, providing the Assessment, Fluency and Conceptual Teaching Engines, upon which our initial product lines are based. As Co-Chairman of the Learning Technology Center at Vanderbilt University, the leading research institution for kids and learning technology, Dr. Hasselbring is a leading researcher in cognitive processing, particularly as it relates to interactive technologies. While remaining on staff at Vanderbilt, he actively contributes to the design and execution of all aspects of product development. Ted will reside in California and will work out of our main office in Tiburon while on sabbatical from Vanderbilt.

GLENN VOLK, VICE PRESIDENT OF PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, PHOENIX STUDIO. Glenn heads up Jazz’s Phoenix Studio and brings with him the nucleus of a team of development engineers and 3D graphic designers with whom he has worked with for a number of years. Glenn has led development projects to create 3D animation tools for Lucas Arts and edutainment and entertainment products for Spectrum Holobyte, Gametek and Hi Tech Expressions. He has a strong track record of delivering licensed properties for Disney Theme Park, Harlem Globetrotters, Wheel of Fortune, Jeopardy, Win Lose or Draw, Tom and Jerry and others which have enabled publishers to win Parent’s Choice awards of excellence and SPA Silver, Gold and Platinum awards for sales.

DAVID ROBINSON , CORPORATE SPOKESPERSON, NBA PLAYER FOR THE SAN ANTONIO SPURS David is in his 8th year in the NBA, where he is a 7-time All-Star, former Rookie of the Year, and 1995 league MVP. His achievements on the basketball court speak for themselves, but David is also committed to education and the use of technology in education. The David Robinson Foundation is a non-profit organization developed to support education in underprivileged neighborhoods. A graduate of the US Naval Academy, David understands what it takes to excel academically and the world of options open to the well-educated. Jazz is honored to welcome him to our team committed to academic achievement.

KIDS ADVISORY BOARD: Jazz’s commitment to innovative educational software starts by making the cut with the children who play our games. Our child play testers and design experts advise us on concept development, character appearance, playability and educational utility of our titles. Conducted in the Novato Unified School District, Jazz has access to grades K-12, with students of a variety of backgrounds. The Novato School District has over 1,000 PC’s installed and provides its schools with T1 lines for Internet access. In addition, Caryl Hughan conducts ongoing user tests in public and private schools in Colorado Springs, Colorado and Northeastern Ohio for geographical balance.

TEACHER ADVISORY BOARD (TAB): The Teacher Advisory Board consists of a geographically diverse group of private, public and parochial educators who review and field test the interactive products, product concepts and collateral material to ensure educator-acceptance of our products. These testers help define the best marketing communication message, positioning our products as a solution to the needs and challenges of classroom teachers.

PARENT ADVISORY BOARD (PAB): The Parent Advisory Board, has its finger on the pulse of Jazz consumers. The PAB consists of a socially and economically diverse groups of parents who have a vested interest in the quality of educational software that their children consume. Jazz uses this feedback to understand and incorporate parental preferences and criteria for family software selections.

PROFESSIONAL ADVISORY BOARD: In addition to the Board of Directors, Jazz Interactive is expanding a Professional Advisory Board to advise the development group on direction in new applications and new technology as they relate to children’s products. Led by Dr. Ted Hasselbring along with other educational, technical and marketing professionals, the Professional Advisory Board meets twice a year. The Management Team has experienced outstanding results by relying on a Professional Advisory Board to guide R & D. The Professional Advisory Board lends credibility and insight to Jazz’s growth and development direction.
